  • Method Details

    • setUser

      @PostMapping("/setUser") public void setUser​(@RequestParam String username)
      The setUser method stores the username provided by the user until it can be retrieved for insertion into the database
      Parameters:
      username -

    • easy

      @GetMapping("/easy") public List<com.example.springboot.Question> easy()
      The easy method is an unused method originally used to learn the workings of the get Mapping. The four methods easyQuestions, mediumQUestions, hardQuestions and freeResponse are modeled on this method. A question is added if there is a question within a table in the database associated with the corresponding difficulty
      Returns:
      it returns a list of questions.

    • easyQuestions

      @GetMapping("/easyQuestions") public List<com.example.springboot.Question> easyQuestions()
      The easyQuestions is a GET method associated with the easy Round of the interview. It selects the questions from the text table in the MySQL database using the unique code , using the MySQL connector functions. This API is called by the JavaScript for the first round of the interview where the questions are printed onto the window. In this round, each question is worth one point
      Returns:
      returns a list of easy questions that appear on the window

    • mediumQuestions

      @GetMapping("/mediumQuestions") public List<com.example.springboot.Question> mediumQuestions()
      The mediumQuestions is a GET method associated with the medium Round of the interview. It selects the questions from the text table in the MySQL database using the unique code 12, using the MySQL connector functions. This API is called by the JavaScript for the second round of the interview where the questions are printed onto the window. In this round, each question is worth two points
      Returns:
      returns a list of medium questions that appear on the window

    • hardQuestions

      @GetMapping("/hardQuestions") public List<com.example.springboot.Question> hardQuestions()
      The hardQuestions is a GET method associated with the hard Round of the interview. It selects the questions from the text table in the MySQL database using the unique code 13, using the MySQL connector functions. This API is called by the JavaScript for the third round of the interview where the questions are printed onto the window. In this round, each question is worth three points
      Returns:
      returns a list of easy questions that appear on the window

    • freeResponse

      @GetMapping("/freeResponse") public List<com.example.springboot.Question> freeResponse()
      The freeResponse is a GET method associated with the System Design Round of the interview. It selects the questions from the text table in the MySQL database using the unique code 14, using the MySQL connector functions. This API is called by the JavaScript for the fourth round of the interview where the questions are printed onto the window. In this round, each question is worth five points
      Returns:
      returns a list of System Design questions that appear on the window

    • submitAnswers

      @PostMapping("/submitAnswers") public boolean submitAnswers​(@RequestParam String pPage, @RequestParam String pAnswers)
      The submitAnswers method exclusively used by the first three rounds of the interview to compute the score per round. It also calls the score method to help compute score based on question number It adds the score of each individual round to the finalScore public variable
      Parameters:
      pPage - is the page number, it is responsible for directing the compiler to the right part of the if statement based on the difficulty level
      pAnswers - is the concatenated string of all the answers provided by the user in the HTML page
      Returns:
      whether the user passed the round that the method is called for

    • submitDesign

      @PostMapping("/submitDesign") public boolean submitDesign​(@RequestBody com.example.springboot.Answer pAnswer)
      The submitAnswers method exclusively used by the last round of the interview to compute the score per round. It also calls the systemDesign method to help compute score based on question number. It adds the score of the round to the finalScore public variable
      Parameters:
      pAnswer - is the body provided by JavaScript containing the page Number 4 and the answers provided by the user in the HTML page
      Returns:
      true, as the user will not know the results of the System Design Round

    • appScore

      @PostMapping("/appScore") public void appScore​(@RequestParam int number)
      the appScore method is an unused method that was originally used to learn how to compute the finalScore of each user. A different method was created later on.
      Parameters:
      number - is the id number of the applicant

    • resetScore

      @PostMapping("/resetScore") public void resetScore()
      The resetScore method is an unused method that was first used to test the score addition in the previous stages, now it is done automatically whenever the easy round is opened

    • extractQuestions

      @PostMapping("/interview") public List<com.example.springboot.Interview> extractQuestions()
      The interview method is an unused method that was originally used to read the questions inputed in the back end through MySQL
      Returns:
      a list of the questions

    • recordUser

      @PostMapping("/recordUser") public String recordUser()
      The recordUser method saves the username and finalScore of every user in a MySQL table after the interview is completed.
      Returns:
      the username of the user
